initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Now let us continue this story. Here is the next part:

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Now let us continue this story. Here is the next part:

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

Olly Alexander was born in London, England, on February 17th, 1989. He grew up listening to pop music and started playing guitar at the age of ten. At sixteen, he formed his first band called "The X Factor". They released two albums together before splitting up. After this, he decided to pursue a solo career.

His debut single "Love Me Like You Do" reached number one in the UK charts. His second single "Stay With Me" also became a hit. In 2012, he won the Brit Award for British Breakthrough Act. The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

Olly Alexander told us he's been working hard on his performance for months now. He's been rehearsing with his band every day and has even hired a choreographer to help him with his moves. He's also been practicing his vocals with a vocal coach. Olly said he's excited about performing in front of such a large audience and hopes he can make everyone proud.

He continued by saying, "I'm really looking forward to representing the UK at Eurovision this year. It's such an amazing opportunity and I can't wait to get out there and show the world what we've got!"

When asked how he felt about being chosen to represent the UK, he replied, "It's an absolute honour and I'm so grateful to be given this chance. I love music and I'm passionate about singing, so I'm going to do my best to give the British people something to cheer about."

He added, "I'm nervous but excited at the same time. I know I've got to put in a lot of work and I'm determined to make sure I do everything I can to represent the UK well."

In terms of his song, he said, "Dizzy" is a great song and I'm confident that it'll go down well with the audience. It's catchy and fun, and I think people will enjoy hearing it."

Regarding his preparations for the competition, he commented, "I've been rehearsing a lot and I'm feeling good about my performance. I've got a great team behind me and I'm ready to give it my all."

Finally, when asked what he thought of the other contestants, he stated, "I haven't seen any of them yet but I'm sure they're all very talented. I'm just going to focus on my own performance and try to make everyone proud."

Overall, Olly seems confident and prepared for the big night. We wish him luck and hope he does the UK proud!

The following year, he released his third studio album "In The Lonely Hour", which included the singles "Stay With Me", "I'm Not The Only One" and "Money On My Mind". This album went platinum in several countries around the world.

In 2016, he released his fourth album "x" (pronounced as "ex"). The lead single from the album was "Thinking Out Loud", which became a global smash hit. The song peaked at number one in over twenty countries including Australia, Canada, Ireland, New Zealand and South Africa. It was also nominated for four Grammy awards.

In 2017, he collaborated with Sam Smith on the song "Too Good At Goodbyes". The song topped the UK Singles Chart and became his highest charting single to date. His fifth album "÷" (pronounced as "divide") was released in March 2018. The album features collaborations with Ed Sheeran, Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars.

On May 9th, 2018, Olly announced via Instagram that he had been diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma. He underwent chemotherapy treatment and surgery. On August 3rd, 2018, he revealed that he had finished his final round of chemotherapy and was cancer free.

On November 5th, 2018, he announced his engagement to his longtime girlfriend, model and actress Emma Corrin. They got married on December 1st, 2018.

On January 4th, 2019, he announced that he would be taking part in the 2019 Eurovision Song Contest. He will represent the United Kingdom with the song "Dizzy".
